ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 111 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 111 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: DS Historical and Political thought is a political theory course that tracks the evolution of philosophy of history and government from Machiavelli to the end of World War II. I would recommend, but not as a history course.

Second semester is way more political theory than first semester, so take what you will out of that. Personally, I found second semester H&P fairly interesting though, again, slightly repetitive on the political theory side. Professor Leaman is a pretty good professor who really places an emphasis on what the students want to discuss.
It was the most rewarding freshman experience in political scholarship and writing I could have asked for.
